Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: 5estrelasTT
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here and I was very surprised. For the price, the Azul Inn was great. They were in the middle of renovating at the time so I did expect some inconvenience but the bed was so comfortable that I didn't notice the ongoing construction. I would definitely stay there again. The only complaints I had was the dark hallway that made me a little cautious as a female as the Inn is very open to foot traffic of non-guests and if you have more than one wifi device (i.e. phone and laptop) you are given one password to access their free wifi network so only one device can access the network at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Not One Complaint !”
Reviews.Author: 702jeffinvegas
Reviews.Content: I had to stay 3 nights in LA on the west side as I do quite often from Las Vegas. I stayed there when it was Travelodge a year ago and promised myself never again. BUT Now, Total turnaround ! This Motel is like Brand New Again. The Entire Guest room had been remodeled, the Hallways, Lobby, and breakfast sitting area have been re-done too. New Flooring in the Lobby. All new Carpet in the guest rooms no more stinky old carpet outside. New Paint through-out. No More Cigarette smell ANYWERE ! so smokers, PLEASE JUST walk around the block, it seems to be a very safe area, or use the "smoking Bench" outside the lobby door. You can walk to Westwood Blvd (and 7-11) and Santa Monica Blvd in less than 5 minutes, jump on a few different buses that will take you Anywere in LA. Century City is a 15 minute walk or a 5 minute bus ride, Westwood 15 minutes by bus, Santa Monica downtown and Beach 30 minutes, maybe? by bus and lots of places to walk/bike to as well. This is a Gem ! No micro-wave in the room, but everything else, Iron and Board, in-room safe! coffee maker an ice machine and Great Pillowtop Beds. No HD Signal but the man at the desk said they were switching providers currently, so maybe, but NEW flat panel tv's and free wi-fi in the room. Double pain windows ( new ) too. I'll be staying there averytime I go to LA Now.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay and so are the rates.”
Reviews.Author: tkroll1953
Reviews.Content: You will not even get close to this nice of a place to stay in w.los angeles for the price ILL BE BACK.

Reviews.Title: “This little retro-styled inn was a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: NDAshley
Reviews.Content: I needed a room nearby the Beverly Hilton (obviously, I can't spend the $300+ it costs to get a room there). I came across the Azul Inn and booked a room, expecting it to be a complete pit. However, I was pleasantly surprised by how cute and clean the room was! As the previous poster said the hallways are a bit shabby, yes, but unless you are planning to sleep in the the hallway corridor, I wouldn't worry about it. My room was totally cute and it has the following benefits: 1) Um..free parking. Where else can you get that in the Beverly Hills area? 2) Close location to major hotels/attractions 3) Friendly front desk staff (usually people that work at motels are super-rude. The guy that checked us in couldn't have been nicer) 4) Free breakfast (it's not the Ritz, but they had a nice selection of danish, juice and coffee. And it's free...so stop complaining people, geez!) The rooms are all decorated in a mid-century modern-esque theme, which I loved. The beds were comfy and the room was huge (for a motel). The area is a bit sketchy if you head toward the freeway, but, again, unless you're planning to wander the streets around the motel at night, you'll be fine. This is the best hotel you'll find in this location, unless you have a fat wallet and want to spend over $300 a night at some of the ritzy places.

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished: Clean & Comfy”
Reviews.Author: drKSG
Reviews.Content: We missed the side road the first time. Pay attention once your are on Santa Monica Blvd going west and crossed Westwood, stay far right and turn immediately into a side road. A few free parking spots in the front but plenty more in the back of the Inn. This is an excellent more economical place to stay if you are visiting UCLA and all the hotels in Westwood are fulled. The reception was friendly, the rooms were newly refurbished, clean and comfy. Complimentary breakfast was good fresh standard fare. We stayed Saturday night, the place was quiet and restful. Good alternative for us when we visit UCLA.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Joan D
Reviews.Content: Located on a frontage road directly across from the LDS Temple. Don't be put off by lack of "curb appeal." Looks like an older 60's motel but rooms have been refurbished. Room was IMMACULATE, completely new bathroom, carpet, bedding, etc. Easy wireless Internet access. Does not have an elevator & rooms open to outside (typical "motel"), but neighborhood felt very safe. Very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - incredible high prices for a room. Crazy!”
Reviews.Author: Califrank
Reviews.Content: Okay, they have some brandnew rooms. Clean. But that is what I EXPECT from a Motel/Hotel! But from the outside this Motel (Ex-Travelodge) looks like a horror-motel! Ugly, unsafe, stinky, dark hallways, and 60(?) years old carpets. This place is a horror! Every Motel 6 all over America is MUCH better!!!!! And the price for a room. Starts from 114 Dollar and up!!!! Plus tax!!!! ha ha ha ha, who is so damn stupid to pay that? Okay, I was..... Never again.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable...”
Reviews.Author: oz_flashpackers
Reviews.Content: this place was ok, suited what we needed - a cheaper place to stay in west la. some staff were helpful +++, some staff were far from helpful (the asian lady who worked at the front desk was not helpful). we had the upgraded larger room. close to restaurants and a 7/11 just down the road. our friends parked their car here with no issues. it seems like a bit of a dodgey area, but generally it seems quiet safe.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for UCLA visitors”
Reviews.Author: FoxyDwarf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just sufficient for people not wanting to spend hundreds on uselessly luxurious rooms. The rooms smell a bit of having been used, and the maids push a bit on chlorine when they clean, but hey, my bed in not too bad (room 248), sheets were clean, the maids were very nice and one of the front desk ppl was very helpful, the others are just fine. Plus, the hotel is close to Culver City, a nice neighborhoos, Rancho Park (another nice one) all the Beverly Hills stuff, and of course UCLA. Very satisfied in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay, Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danhoffma
Reviews.Content: My room in this hotel stank--and one of the pillows stank of urine! The place is falling apart and when I checked in on March 28 with very rude and unprofessional night clerk, she was very unhelpful. Car windows had been broken in the car lot on the night I was there. The so-called continental breakfast consisted of over ripe bananas and stale rolls. In spite of all of this, the morning front desk clerk was a very nice person and very helpful. I recommend by-passing this place. There are other places in LA that are at least clean. I cut my stay here and moved elsewhere. What else can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: passiflorabear
Reviews.Content: We visited LACMA, Beverly Hills, Westwood, Santa Monica, and the Getty Center, so the motel's location was convenient. Our room opened to Santa Monica Blvd, so it was a bit noisy, but it was a good, no-frills room with free wifi at a decent price. The complimentary breakfast was appreciated--pastries, bagels, coffee, and juices.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zara_S
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very clean with lots of parking space. but it was TOO NOISY (near fire station). and again the tv for one of the neighbors was too loud and they had party from 11pm to 4am.!!! I asked the front desk 2 times to take care of that, but they did NOTHING. I had to go and knock their door. they were so drunk.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good pick but bearable!”
Reviews.Author: 77pearl
Reviews.Content: The motel is directly on Santa Monica Blvd, which is good and bad. The walls are thin so you can hear all the traffic on the Blvd which continues until about midnight. We could also hear the doors downstairs opening and shutting. We had to turn on the fan to drown out the noise. What's good is that it is a 15 minute drive from Santa Monica Pier and 20-25 minutes from LA (around Mann's Chinese Theater) depending on traffic (rush hour could take twice as long). No bathtub, just a shower. No fast-food restaurants within walking distance. Pool was really tiny and not heated. Wouldn't recommend it for more than 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else, please!”
Reviews.Author: tobysmom64
Reviews.Content: The room carpet was very worn. The bathroom was dirty, with pieces of wall missing under the sink. The only advantage is the location, but even with that plus, I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “thatÂ´s ist after 11 hours flight”
Reviews.Author: luicap
Reviews.Content: located near westwood - lots of good restaurants - this is a fine stop after a long intercontinental flight. Book a room fronting the backyard so thereÂ´s not much noise from the street. some rooms have beds with plastic mats which make you sweat. we put them away weÂ´ve been to the travelodge twice and we will come back on our next trip to death valley.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sltravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel since it was close to UCLA. When we arrived at 4 pm, we were given keys to go to the room. When we went to the room, it was not ready and maid was still cleaning it. We were asked to wait another 30 minutes. Finally when we got the room, the toilet was not working. I had to call at least 5 times for them to come and fix it. They kept coming and say it is done but it was not fixed. Finally manager came and he said it is fixed and it was not. Four of us had to use the office toilet until about 9 pm. Never agian I will saty in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A huge mistake”
Reviews.Author: golden_planet
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a place I would recommend. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, which is truly fantastic, and the price is not bad, but the hotel sure is. The first interaction with the front desk should have been warning enough, but even that could not prepare us for such a poor experience. We arrived at around 1pm and were told the room would not be ready for another hour. Having flown in from a 10 hour flight this was the last thing we needed, but when we went up to at least drop off our luggage we almost checked out then and there. The rooms are old, dirty and poorly kept. For the great location you pay the price of being right on Santa Monica, a major street with a ton of traffic so the rooms are very noisy. If you must stay here be sure to ask for a room facing the back alley, let them know what time you will be arriving to ensure theyâ€™ll have a room ready, and let them know your room preference (we reserved on line and requested two beds, but were given a king size bed on arrival and had to pay extra for the room change). But really, there is no reason to stay here at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for a good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: LAlocal
Reviews.Content: I live in Los Angeles and had to vacate my apartment for refurbishing. I certainly did not look forward to living in a motel for 2 weeks. This is a GREAT locale because it is a quiet, safe, upper middle class neighborhood near UCLA and Santa Monica. It is situated between two 7-11's and a McDonald's is within walking distance. It is directly across from a Mormon Temple. You can also easily walk to Westwood Boulevard, which has anything you want. Century City is up the road. If you are coming from out of town and are on a budget, you might want to consider this motel. It's central location will allow you easy access to wherever you want to go, although it is NOT near the metro. There are buses running up and down Santa Monica Boulevard, however. I had zero problems with the parking, which is free. The room I stayed in, #241, was a non smoking, queen bedded room. It was completely new. In fact, it had that new carpet smell. Everything, including the wallpaper and all the furnishings were in perfect condition. It also has a small refrigerator with freezer tray and Free HBO and basic cable. I did spot one roach, but that is to be expected in a motel. It didn't "freak" me out as I normally would be, primarily because the room could not have been any cleaner. The overall condition of the building was very good. Not the Paris Ritz by any stretch of the imagination, but if you are new to the city and don't want to be looking over your shoulder every time you walk out the door, I recommend staying here. For the $75 a night I paid, I couldn't imagine a better bargain. A nice touch was the free internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “a little friend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: usually when I sleep in hotels, the day after I put anything I have in my baggage and I close it up... I don't like people touch my stuff... but one morning I forgot.... when I come back in my room, in the night, I found my pijama on the furniture (where I left it), I took it and a lillte bug felt on the floor and ran behind my bed... I put my pijama in a plastic bag... I would have burned it if I had a lighter... I slept with the lights on dreaming about a terrible bug walking on my skin... AWFUL !!! There is a bad smell in the room, and the sink is yellow near the hole... and what about the pool? nothing, I'm not so brave to dive into a green water pool...

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a very enjoyable stay - the rooms are average and the traffic noises fairly high but at the same time it's walking distance to Century City, Beverly Hills (3 miles) and Westwood Village. Shopping centers to the East, North and South and the staff were very hospitable. I'd come again.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, in need of demolition”
Reviews.Author: keithreddy
Reviews.Content: What a dump is right. The worst Motel we have ever stayed in. Wouldn't even get 1* from us. There is no excuse for this standard even from Travelodge. Everything about the place is worn out, old and decrepid, and the service is not much better. Our advice, avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convinience in West LA”
Reviews.Author: Sherwood77
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for budget consious convinience, this Travelodge fits the bill. The ability to exit onto Overland Ave made getting around LA easy, I'd assume that whenever the construction on Santa Monica Blvd is completed that would be an advantage as well. The area around the motel doesn't have much in the way of things to do or places to eat, but as long as you have a car (this is LA remember) the convinience factor more than trumps that.

Reviews.Title: “An old property with good service at a low price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The LA West Travelodge has been where I've hung my hat for about a year of business commuting, with monthly stays of about 4 nights per visit. I chose it because it's not the LAX Motel 6, it's near bus lines on Westwood and Santa Monica Blvds, and it's pretty much the cheapest rate you can find in LA. The downsides: The property is badly in need of refurbishing, and nearby Santa Monica Blvd is basically a raceway. My advice: ask for a second-floor room when you arrive. The rooms get very warm and usually don't have enough windows, so you'll be running the air conditioner most days out of the year. You can generally leave the AC on during the day while you're out, without the maid turning it off, if you leave the temperature set to "normal." That helps keep it cooler. Depending on how loud the AC turns on and off, which varies depending on the room, I've generally found I get a restful night's sleep only when wearing earplugs, but I'm a fairly light sleeper. The shower heads are pretty searing and positioned too low. They do indeed have a pool, but it's never available when I'm there, before or after business hours. They lock it up, for obvious reasons. The upsides: Although it won't look it when you arrive, the surrounding neighborhood, near the Mormon Temple, is actually pretty decent. I jog during the mornings southward down Overland Ave, past an elementary school. There's a Seven Eleven right across the street. Each room I've stayed in also has a mini refrigerator. Santa Monica Big Blue Buses troll along Westwood and Santa Monica up to Westwood, but that's about a 4 block hike. It's incredibly cheap for LA, which is no doubt why the place is in disrepair. You get free bagels/danishes/coffee in the mornings until 10am. The service tends to be pretty good, although the morning guy is a little odd. And best of all, they frequently have rooms available, and you can cancel up until 4pm day-of. They claim not to guarantee parking, but I've never had a problem with it. You probably will want a rental car in this location, since it's far from anything including Westwood, unless you enjoy waiting for buses. (I kind of do!) Bottom Line: Cheap! You'll save money, but you won't want to hang out there a whole lot.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September 2003. I had a reservation for 3 nights, but left after the first night. The room was cramped, and looked and smelled none too clean. Carpets were stained. When the air conditioning came on it sounded like a 747 landing next to the bed, and it went off with a loud clang. Combined with the traffic noise, a good night's sleep was next to impossible.
